item.name: 6 nimmt!
item.comment: nice little filler game, too much and it gets old quickly

item.name: Age of Conan: The Strategy Board Game
item.comment: ok as a 4 player, anything less was a waste of time

item.name: Agricola
item.comment: Good solid game with lots of strategy and multiple configurations. Not going to get bored with this one for a while

item.name: Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small
item.comment: Fun but not as good as Agricola. Didn't like the timing mechanic of game ending when the fences run out.

item.name: Alhambra
item.comment: Love this game but the group hates it on its own and will only just bear it with the thieves turn expansion

item.name: Android: Netrunner
item.comment: Old Netrunner was the best CCG from the ccg explosion, this new version cleans up some stuff, adds new bits and just scores a 10 clean out of the gates.

item.name: Android: Netrunner – A Study in Static
Arkham Horror
item.comment: Best coop game out there, bar none

item.name: Arkham Horror: The King in Yellow Expansion
Ascension: Deckbuilding Game
item.comment: Fun game but got too fiddly with later expansions. Replaced by the iOS version and LOTR deckbuilder

item.name: Ascension: Return of the Fallen
item.comment: Fun game but got too fiddly with later expansions. Replaced by the iOS version and LOTR deckbuilder

item.comment: Ok, kid friendly game. Plays in under 15 minutes usually

item.comment: Have multiple copies of the Brute Force pack to trade

item.comment: great little 5 minute game to play with the kids

item.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game

item.comment: Fun but only if all players know how to play poker and ccg's... overall it was too much for my regular group

item.comment: The first deck builder and probably still one of the best.

item.name: Dominion: Intrigue
item.comment: Introduces a lot more interaction to the base game. Not always for the better but still fun

item.name: Dominion: Prosperity
item.comment: Best expansion for one of the best deck builders.

item.name: Dragon Slayer
item.comment: beer and pretzels game to play before the rest of the group arrives.

item.name: Duel of Ages II
item.comment: 1st play and seems a good solid game. Melee seems quite a deal breaker but sniping with fire and op fire can work wonders as well. Next game, will use the guardian cards.

item.name: Dune CCG
item.comment: Great game, but waaaayy too complex for a CCG

item.name: Dungeon Lords
item.comment: Great game, just seems to take far too long to play.

item.name: Dungeon Twister 2: Prison
item.comment: lovely mini's, great strategy, poor combat, shame :(

item.name: Lords of Waterdeep
item.comment: Actually re-introduced the wife to boardgames... and she asked to play again!!! :shocked
item.wishlistcomment: looks real good after Game night show ===================================== From Secret Santa 2013

item.name: Lords of Waterdeep: Scoundrels of Skullport
item.wishlistcomment: looks real good after Game night show

item.name: Love Letter: Legend of the Five Rings
Mage Knight Board Game
item.comment: Seems to have edged out Runebound as the groups favourite game. No issues found and no game breakers so it makes for a much more balanced game. ============================================== Enjoyable first play. Could even turn out to be as good as Runebound

item.name: Mage Knight Board Game: Krang Character Expansion
Mage Knight Board Game: Shades of Tezla Expansion
Mage Knight Board Game: The Lost Legion
Mage Wars Arena
item.comment: Magic the gathering but with positioning, better deck building, access to all your deck, more involvement by your character.... just better overall :)

item.name: Mage Wars: Druid vs. Necromancer
item.comment: Necromancer good, Druid terrible!

item.name: Magic: The Gathering
item.comment: The grandaddy of CCG's Shame it got bloated so much with all the expansions and added complexity

item.name: Mansions of Madness: ‘Til Death Do Us Part
item.comment: Good theme, but a few inconsistancies on the story.

item.name: Marvel Dice Masters: Age of Ultron
Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men
Middle-Earth
item.comment: All gone :) ================================================== Traded away everything apart from the Balrog boxes. Make me a good offer and they could be yours. ================================================== Own both Balrog packs, still sealed and a few promos and a couple of boosters. Never played so off to trade with you!

item.name: Might & Magic Heroes
item.wishlistcomment: Looks comparible to MK: Boardgame or Runebound. Hero exploring around doing quests, should be good for the group.

item.name: Munchkin Cthulhu
item.comment: not as funny as the other munchkins

item.name: Netrunner
item.comment: One of the two best CCG's from the CCG boom (other being Legend of the Five Rings)

item.name: New World: A Carcassonne Game
item.comment: ok, but not as fun as the original

item.name: Pocket Civ
item.comment: Home crafted version

item.name: Quarriors!
item.comment: Loved the concept. loved the demo at Dragonmeet, loved the game when I got home. Clear winner. Also a nice quick game to play before all the group arrive for the main game of the day, whatever that may be.

item.name: Quarriors! Rise of the Demons
item.comment: Added 3 dice types and some nice mechanics to screw up your opponents. Just felt that there could have been more to it.

item.name: Resident Evil Deck Building Game: Alliance
Resident Evil Deck Building Game: Chris Redfield & Jill Valentine Promo
The Resistance: Avalon
item.comment: Works better with more players and people who actually discuss what's happening. Quiet players could kill a play of this game.

item.name: Risk: Lord of the Rings Expansion Set (incl. Siege of Minas Tirith game)
Risk: The Lord of the Rings
Rune Age
item.comment: Has to be one of the fastest deckbuilding games around. Strong flavour, 4 scenarios, 4 factions, lots of neutral cards and cities. Just quick, honest fun. Great game

item.name: Runebound (First Edition)
item.comment: Great game, but made even better with 2nd Edition

item.name: Runebound (Second Edition)
item.comment: The game to go to for me. Best game I can think of that has so many options for each turn. Yes there are restrictions in movement with the dice, but without those a lot of structure of the game would be lost.

item.name: Runebound: Crown of the Elder Kings
Runebound: The Terrors of the Tomb
Runewars
item.comment: rated 9 for the base game, 10 with the expansion

item.name: Seasons
item.comment: Mix of dice and cards and the timing of the game gives a huge amount of strategy.

item.name: Serpent's Tongue
item.comment: amazing art, good design, nice price, poor communication, abysmal timing

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game

item.comment: Good way to take the original game and break it... :(

Ticket to Ride: The Card Game
Tomb: Cryptmaster
item.comment: The only game I have ever sold because it was so bad. If you can get past the terrible rulebook then the game plays better than it sounds initially, but it then turns into who had best setup. And god forbid you fall behind... no way back after a bad move or being pounded by another player. This game has made me stay away from AEG games for a long while.
